benchmark_details.name: SA-Eval
benchmark_details.overview: SA-Eval is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate models on three tasks: audio event classification, audio captioning, and audio question answering, across two levels of difficulty (easy and hard), utilizing speech instructions and acoustic context.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of SA-Eval is to rigorously evaluate models' abilities to understand and respond to audio-related tasks and speech instructions under various acoustic conditions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: SA-Eval currently focuses only on single-turn dialogues, limiting its ability to assess multi-turn complex dialogues.

data.source: Derived from test sets of widely used datasets such as VGGSound, AudioSet, FSD50K, AudioCaps, Clotho V2, and Clotho-AQA.
data.annotation: Annotated through a combination of automated generation and human judgment.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions compared to ground truth, with detailed scoring for accuracy and relevance.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metric scores signify better performance of models in understanding and responding to audio tasks effectively.
methodology.baseline_results: SOLLA serves as a baseline, with performance compared to other models evaluated on the SA-Eval dataset.
methodology.validation: Validation is performed by employing both automated scoring metrics and human raters for the generated outputs.

harm: Incorrect audio comprehension can lead to misunderstandings in real-world applications.
